channel.title: Porter Pearson's GitHub Site
channel.description: Recent content on Porter Pearson's GitHub Site

item.title: Was Kobe Bryant robbed of the 2005-06 MVP award?
item.description: It’s the most prestigious individual award in basketball. It can single-handedly push a player’s ticket to the Hall of Fame. It’s the NBA MVP award. Many years, a single player stands head and shoulders above the rest and runs away with the award. In 2006, Steve Nash won 924 of a possible 1250 points in the MVP vote. Yet, he didn’t quite stand head and shoulders above the rest of the field.

item.title: Does the 1985 NBA draft class deserve more credit?
item.description: Every year when the NBA draft rolls around, the question arises: what is the greatest NBA draft class of all time? Ask just about anyone who follows the NBA and they’ll give you one of three answers: 1984, 1996 or 2003. And with good reason. The numbers speak for themselves: With four Hall of Fame Inductees, 12 combined championships and seven All-Stars, the ’84 draft features all-time greats such as Michael Jordan, Hakeem Olajuwon, Charles Barkley and John Stockton.

item.title: Cleaning Up Datasets: An Example
item.description: Sometimes data isn’t packaged the way we need it to be. Let’s walk through an example on how to fix that. First, I’ll load up my libraries. library(tidyverse) ## -- Attaching packages --------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.1 -- ## v ggplot2 3.3.5 v purrr 0.3.4 ## v tibble 3.1.3 v dplyr 1.0.7 ## v tidyr 1.1.3 v stringr 1.4.0 ## v readr 2.0.1 v forcats 0.5.1 ## -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------ tidyverse_conflicts() -- ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggalt) ## Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggalt': ## method from ## grid.

item.title: About Porter Pearson
item.description: Porter Pearson is a junior at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln, seeking majors in business administration and sports media and communication.
